action.primary: Strengthens the Spleen and stops diarrhea

indications: Chronic diarrhea due to Spleen Deficiency (especially useful for children)
Chronic diarrhea due to Internal Accumulation of Damp (weak transportation)

action.primary: Stabilizes the Kidneys and astringes Jing

indications: Kidney Qi Deficiency with nocturnal emission, premature ejaculation, spermatorrhea and urinary incontinence or frequency
Vaginal discharge due to either Deficiency or Damp-Heat

contraindications: Use caution with those who have difficulty either urinating or defecating.

useCases: Chronic diarrhea due to Spleen Deficiency.
Chronic diarrhea due to Spleen Deficiency with Dampness.
Spermatorrhea, premature ejaculation, urinary frequency or vaginal discharge due to Kidney Deficiency.
Tonifies Kidney Qi and strengthens Jing to treat cloudy urine or spermatorrhea.
Loose stools and diarrhea due to Spleen Deficiency.
Spermatorrhea, premature ejaculation and urinary frequency due to Kidney Deficiency with a stronger effect
Profuse, clear vaginal discharge due to Spleen and Kidney Deficiency.
Incontinence due to instability of the Kidney base.
Vaginal discharge due to Cold from Deficiency of the lower base.
Reestablishes communication between the Heart and Kidneys.
Treats nocturnal emissions, premature ejaculation or urinary incontinence due to the failure of the Kidney's storage functions.
Inhibits chronic diarrhea or dysentery, watery and thin vaginal discharge and turbid, painful urinary dysfunction due to Spleen Deficiency or Spleen and Kidney Deficiency.

notes: This herb is included in formulas for treating loss of body fluids and failure of the Spleen and Kidneys to filter Dampness.
Contains starch similar to arrowroot and is used as a food especially during illness with weakened digestion.
It is sold in Chinese grocery stores as foxnut.

Both Qian Shi and Sm. Nelumbinis #{LianZi} Lian Zi are seeds that tonify and bind, with sweet, neutral and astringent properties. They both enter the Spleen and Kidneys to tonify those organs and treat chronic diarrhea and spermatorrhea. Qian Shi also eliminates Dampness and is better at treating Deficiency disorders in which Dampness predominates, such as vaginal discharge. Lian Zi nourishes the Heart, reestablishes communication between the Heart and Kidneys and treats incessant uterine bleeding.
Dry-fried Euryales Seeds Chao Qian Shi are warming and thus able to tonify the Spleen and Kidneys and to stabilize and conserve. They are used to treat spermatorrhea due to failure of the Jing Gate
Bran-fried Euryale Seeds Fu Chao Qian Shi are warm and better to tonify and stabilize especially for chronic diarrhea due to Spleen Deficiency.
